itemDescription: Royal Navy officer during the American War of Independence, and the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, rising to vice-admiral.

wikipedia_page.main: Shuldham Peard (1761 – 27 December 1832) was an officer of the Royal Navy. He rose to the rank of vice-admiral after seeing service in the American War of Independence, and the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.  He was the father of John Whitehead Peard, who was known as 'Garibaldi's Englishman'.
